description: Rich and fudgy brownies with crushed Oreos baked in and on top.
ingredients: [{"name": "brown sugar", "units": "cup", "amount": "¾"}, {"name": "granulated sugar", "units": "cup", "amount": "½"}, {"name": "vegetable oil", "units": "cup", "amount": "¼"}, {"name": "unsalted butter", "units": "tbsp", "amount": "10"}, {"name": "eggs", "units": "large", "amount": "3"}, {"name": "vanilla extract", "units": "tsp", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "dark chocolate", "units": "oz", "amount": "4"}, {"name": "all-purpose flour", "units": "cup", "amount": "⅔"}, {"name": "unsweetened cocoa powder", "units": "cup", "amount": "⅓"}, {"name": "cornstarch", "units": "tbsp", "amount": "2"}, {"name": "sea salt", "units": "tsp", "amount": "¾"}, {"name": "Oreo cookies", "units": "cookies", "amount": "28"}]
instructions: 1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line an 8×8 baking pan with parchment paper. 2. Melt together the dark chocolate and butter over medium heat, stirring until smooth. 3. Allow to cool slightly, then whisk in the sugars. 4. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, cornstarch, and sea salt. 5. Add eggs one at a time to the chocolate mixture, then stir in vanilla. 6. Fold in the dry ingredients until just combined. 7. Fold in ¾ of the crushed Oreos. 8. Transfer to the prepared pan, top with remaining Oreos, and bake for 25-30 minutes. 9. Let cool before slicing.
notes: If you like extra gooey brownies, you can slightly underbake them. Make sure to crush Oreos to roughly the same size for even distribution.
